info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 3:35PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected as well as gusty winds and blowing snow above 6000 foot elevations and along and north of the Mount Shasta to Medicine Lake highlands. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches below 3500 foot elevations and in the Tennant and Highway 97 areas, and 12 to 24 inches above 3500 foot elevations. Winds gusts 60 to 80 mph above 6000 foot elevations. * WHERE...All areas including Interstate 5 and Highway 89. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility to whiteout at higher elevations and blizzard conditions should be expected on Mount Shasta and across exposed mountain areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur during the day on Monday along the Interstate 5 corridor. Snow levels are then likely to rise Monday evening through Tuesday morning to near 4,000 feet with impacts continuing along Highway 89 and at higher elevations. Monday evening through Tuesday morning southwest flow could result in continued wet snow from Dunsmuir to McCloud, at times. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
